commands/dispatcher.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * @file commands/dispatcher.h
00003  *
00004  * This files contains various utilities which operate on the commands registry
00005  * to parse a shell like command string and to call the command with the
00006  * retrieved arguments.
00007  */
00008 
00009 
00010 #pragma once
00011 #include "registry.h"
00012 
00013 
00014 /**
00015  * The maximum number of tokens which an array should be able to contain.
00016  */
00017 #define MAX_ARGC 100
00018 
00019 
00020 /**
00021  * Parses a command string and populates an array with the obtained tokens.
00022  *
00023  * @pre  \a args is an array of size \c MAX_ARGC
00024  *
00025  * @param[in]  cmd   The string containing the command to parse.
00026  * @param[out] args  The array which will be populated with the tokens obtained
00027  *                   by parsing the \a cmd argument.
00028  *
00029  * @return  The number of found tokens (the count of items in \a args) or a
00030  *          negative error code if the function fails.
00031  */
00032 int command_parse(const char * cmd, char * args[]);
00033 
00034 
00035 /**
00036  * Takes a list of tokens and its count and executes the registered command.
00037  * This function takes the first ite in \a argv and retrieves the command
00038  * from the registry using this string.
00039  *
00040  * @param[in] argc  The number of tokens contained in \a argv.
00041  * @param[in] argv  The tokens as returned by the \c command_parse function.
00042  *
00043  * @return  The status code of the executed command (either 0 or a positive
00044  *          error code if the command execution failed) or a negative error code
00045  *          if it was not possible to call the command.
00046  */
00047 int command_dispatch(int argc, char * argv[]);
00048 
00049 
00050 /**
00051  * Shortcut function to directly parse and dispatch a command in one step.
00052  * This function calls \c command_parse and passes its results to
00053  * \c command_dispatch
00054  *
00055  * @param[in] cmd  The string containing the command to parse.
00056  *
00057  * @return  The value returned by the \c command_dispatch function call.
00058  */
00059 int command_parse_and_dispatch(const char * cmd);
